pages.text: Nanuqsaurus was a genus of tyrannosaurid dinosaur that lived during the Late Cretaceous Period (approximately 70-69 million years ago) in what is now Alaska, United States. It was characterized by its small size, reaching around 6-7 meters (20-23 feet) in length, and its unique adaptations to the cold, polar environment in which it lived. Nanuqsaurus is known from a partial skull and other skeletal remains, which suggest that it was a close relative of the larger, more well-known tyrannosaurs such as Tyrannosaurus rex. It represents an important example of the diversity of tyrannosaurids during the Late Cretaceous.
Didcha know that Nanuqsaurus means "polar bear lizard" in Inuktitut? It's like a tiny T. rex, but in the Arctic!
